messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Admin/CommentController.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\CommentController` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full path:
/admin/comments/{comment}

All HTTP methods acceptable: false

Allowed methods (based on the route/resource definitions in routes/admin.php and the controller actions present):
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: false
- PUT: true
- DELETE: true
- PATCH: true

Explanation
- routes/admin.php registers a resource for "comments" but only the actions index, edit, update and destroy:
  - index -> GET    /comments
  - edit  -> GET    /comments/{comment}/edit
  - update-> PUT/PATCH /comments/{comment}
  - destroy-> DELETE   /comments/{comment}
- The project uses an "admin" routes file and the controller redirects use route names like 'admin.comments.edit', which indicates these routes are loaded with an "admin" prefix and route name prefix (the standard Laravel setup). That yields the full paths starting with /admin, so the item resource path is /admin/comments/{comment}.
- The item path /admin/comments/{comment} therefore accepts the update and destroy verbs: PUT, PATCH and DELETE.
- GET is not registered for /comments/{comment} (there is no "show" action in the only(...) list), so GET (and therefore HEAD for that path) is not acceptable based on the code given.
- OPTIONS and TRACE are not explicitly defined in the route declarations, so they are marked false per the instruction to base acceptability on the code, not runtime/framework behavior.
